column1: '''Seek for the Sword that was broken''' is a rhyme that appeared in dreams to [[Faramir]] and later his brother [[Boromir]].
{{quote|In that dream I thought the eastern sky grew dark and there was a growing thunder
column2: but in the West a pale light lingered
column3: and out of it I heard a voice

column1: Seek for [[Narsil|the Sword that was broken]]:
There shall be shown a token
That Doom is near at hand

column2: he did not speak of it. He had the dream twice again
column3: and his brother had it once. Neither knew what exactly the "Doom" and "Isildur's Bane" referred to
column4: nor where "Imladris" was. Their [[Denethor|father]] told Boromir that Imladris was where Lord [[Elrond]] dwelt
column5: and the road being too dangerous
column6: Boromir took it upon himself to follow this lead.

column1: '''1981: ''[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|The Lord of the Rings]]'':'''
:The song is sung by [[Matthew Vine]] in a high-pitched voice at the Council of Elrond. It is the reason for Boromir's coming to Rivendell
